trans-unit.source: Provides a command adapter class for the XHTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The control adapters in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters> namespace provide XHTML rendering and processing for mobile controls on a variety of display devices.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlCommandAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command"></xref>.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the adapter handles loading the post data.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Identifies the control.
Contains the collection of all incoming name values.
Provides a place to send data that is private to the control and that might be required for the loading of post data.
The control determines the type that is passed to this parameter.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the required object in `controlPrivateData` was changed, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent*> event can be raised.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the adapter handles loading the post data; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Renders the control and its content on the client using the provided <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
